titleInfo.title: Letter No 27 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that the Resident has received a reply from Sooltan bin Suggur [Sulṭān bin Saqr]. It reports that he has restored Shaikh Abdolla bin Rasched to Umal Guwyn, though notes that the Resident is not aware of the precise circumstances surrounding this. It mentions that Sooltan bin Suggur is upset as he perceives himself to have been the only chief to be required to tear down his fortifications, to which the letter outlines the Resident's response.It also briefly reports on the Resident's efforts to establish native agents in Bahrain and at Sharga [Sharjah].
